description: Triangle read by rows: T(m,n) = number of solutions to 1 <= a(1) < a(2) < ... < a(m) <= n, where GCD( a(1), a(2), ....a(m), n) = 1.
references: Temba Shonhiwa, A Generalization of the Euler and Jordan Totient Functions, Fib. Quart., 37 (1999), 67-76.
maple: A020921 := proc(n,k) option remember ; local divs ; if n <= 0 then 1 ; elif k > n then 0 ; else divs := numtheory[divisors](n) ; add(numtheory[mobius](op(i,divs))*binomial(n/op(i,divs),k),i=1..nops(divs)) ; fi ; end: nmax := 10 ; for row from 0 to nmax do for col from 0 to row do printf("%d,",A020921(row,col)) ; od ; od ; # _R. J. Mathar_, Feb 12 2007
mathematica: nmax = 11; t[n_, k_] := Total[ MoebiusMu[#]*Binomial[n/#, k] & /@ Divisors[n]]; t[0, 0] = 1; Flatten[ Table[t[n, k], {n, 0, nmax}, {k, 0, n}]] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Oct 20 2011, after PARI *)
prog: (PARI) {T(n, k) = if( n<=0, k==0 && n==0, sumdiv(n, d, moebius(d) * binomial(n/d, k)))}
crossrefs: (Left-hand) columns include A000010, A102309. Row sums are essentially A027375.
author: _Michael Somos_, Nov 17 2002
